    • Method Detail

      • getBranchNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getBranchNames()
        Returns an immutable set, containing all branch names.
        Returns:
        The immutable set of all branch names. Never null. Will always at least contain the master branch.

      • getKeyspacesInBranch

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeyspacesInBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Returns the immutable set of known keyspace names in the given branch.
        Parameters:
        branchName - The name of the branch to retrieve the keyspaces for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The immutable set of known keyspace names in the given branch. May be empty, but never null. Is guaranteed to be empty for non-existing branches.

      • getNumberOfBranches

        int getNumberOfBranches()
        Returns the number of branches.
        Returns:
        The number of branches. Guaranteed to be greater than or equal to one (the master branch).

      • getMaximumBranchingDepth

        int getMaximumBranchingDepth()
        Returns the maximum branching depth in the database.

        A branch B1 that has master as origin has branching depth 1. A branch B2 that has B1 as origin has branching depth 2, etc. The master branch has branching depth zero by definition.

        Returns:
        The maximum branching depth. Always greater than or equal to zero.
        See Also:
        getAverageBranchingDepth()

      • getAverageBranchingDepth

        double getAverageBranchingDepth()
        Returns the average branching depth. For a definition of "branching depth", please see getMaximumBranchingDepth().
        Returns:
        The average branching depth over all non-master branches. Will be zero if there are no branches other than the master, or a value greater than or equal to one if there is at least one branch.

      • getMasterBranchChunks

        int getMasterBranchChunks()
        Returns the number of chunks in the master branch.

        For all backends that do not support chunks, this method will return 1.

        Returns:
        the number of chunks in the master branch. Guaranteed to be greater than or equal to 1.

      • getNumberOfChunksInBranch

        int getNumberOfChunksInBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Returns the number of chunks in the given branch.

        For all backends that do not support chunks, this method will return 1 for all existing branches.

        Parameters:
        branchName - the name of the branch to fetch the chunk count for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A value greater than or equal to 1 representing the number of chunks, if the given branch exists; otherwise zero.

      • getAverageNumberOfChunksPerNonMasterBranch

        double getAverageNumberOfChunksPerNonMasterBranch()
        Returns the average number of chunks in all branches (master branch).
        Returns:
        The average number of chunks. Will be zero for backends that do not support chunks, or if there are no other branches. Will be a value greater than or equal to 1 in all other cases.

      • getTotalNumberOfGetOperations

        long getTotalNumberOfGetOperations()
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.get(String) operations executed on this database so far.
        Returns:
        The number of get operations. Never negative.

      • getTotalNumberOfPutOperations

        long getTotalNumberOfPutOperations()
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.put(String, Object) operations executed on this database so far.
        Returns:
        The number of put operations. Never negative.

      • getTotalNumberOfRemoveOperations

        long getTotalNumberOfRemoveOperations()
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.remove(String) operations executed on this database so far.
        Returns:
        The number of remove operations. Never negative.

      • getNumberOfGetOperationsWithin

        long getNumberOfGetOperationsWithin(ChronoDBStatistics.HeadMinus headMinus)
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.get(String) operations executed on this database within the given time range since the head revision.

        Examples include: 

         statistics.getNumberOfOperationsWithin(HeadMinus.TEN_SECONDS); // #1
 statistics.getNumberOfOperationsWithin(HeadMinus.ONE_HOUR); // #2

        It is important to note that a get operation that belongs to the ChronoDBStatistics.HeadMinus.ONE_MINUTE group will not be counted for the ChronoDBStatistics.HeadMinus.FIVE_MINUTES group. Each get belongs to at most one time group.

        Parameters:
        headMinus - The time distance between the get call timestamp and the head revision timestamp.
        Returns:
        The number of get operations within the given time delta since the head revision. Never negative.
        See Also:
        getNumberOfGetOperationsInOlderHistory()

      • getNumberOfGetOperationsInOlderHistory

        long getNumberOfGetOperationsInOlderHistory()
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.get(String) operations executed on timestamps not retrievable via getNumberOfGetOperationsWithin(HeadMinus).
        Returns:
        The number of get operations executed on older history. Never negative.

      • getNumberOfGetOperationsOnBranch

        long getNumberOfGetOperationsOnBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.get(String) operations executed on the given branch.
        Parameters:
        branchName - The branch to retrieve the number of executed get operations for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The number of get operations on the given branch. May be zero. Will be zero for any non-existing branch.

      • getNumberOfPutOperationsOnBranch

        long getNumberOfPutOperationsOnBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.put(String, Object) operations executed on the given branch.
        Parameters:
        branchName - The branch to retrieve the number of executed put operations for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The number of put operations on the given branch. May be zero. Will be zero for any non-existing branch.

      • getNumberOfRemoveOperationsOnBranch

        long getNumberOfRemoveOperationsOnBranch(java.lang.String branchName)
        Returns the number of ChronoDBTransaction.remove(String) operations executed on the given branch.
        Parameters:
        branchName - The branch to retrieve the number of executed remove operations for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The number of remove operations on the given branch. May be zero. Will be zero for any non-existing branch.

      • getNumberOfEntryCacheHits

        long getNumberOfEntryCacheHits()
        Returns the total number of entry cache misses, i.e. ChronoDBTransaction.get(String) calls that were not answered by the cache.
        Returns:
        The number of entry cache misses. Will be fixed at -1 if entry caching is disabled.
        See Also:
        getNumberOfEntryCacheHits(), getNumberOfQueryCacheHits(), getNumberOfQueryCacheMisses()

      • getNumberOfEntryCacheMisses

        long getNumberOfEntryCacheMisses()
        Returns the total number entry cache hits, i.e. ChronoDBTransaction.get(String) calls that were answered by the cache.
        Returns:
        The number of entry cache hits. Will be fixed at -1 if entry caching is disabled.
        See Also:
        getNumberOfEntryCacheMisses(), getNumberOfQueryCacheHits(), getNumberOfQueryCacheMisses()

      • getNumberOfQueryCacheHits

        long getNumberOfQueryCacheHits()
        Returns the total number of query cache hits.
        Returns:
        The number of query cache hits. Will be fixed at -1 if query caching is disabled.

      • getNumberOfQueryCacheMisses

        long getNumberOfQueryCacheMisses()
        Returns the total number of query cache misses.
        Returns:
        The number of query cache misses. Will be fixed at -1 if query caching is disabled.

      • getActiveSecondaryIndices

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getActiveSecondaryIndices()
        Returns the immutable set of active secondary index names.
        Returns:
        The immutable set of secondary index names. Never null, may be empty.

      • getNumberOfIndexDocuments

        long getNumberOfIndexDocuments()
        Returns the total number of index documents that constitute the secondary index.
        Returns:
        The total number of index documents. Always greater than or equal to zero.

      • getDiskFootprintInBytes

        long getDiskFootprintInBytes()
        Estimates the footprint of this database instance on disk (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The estimated footprint of this database on disk, in bytes.
